org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.canvas
Interface Layer

All Known Subinterfaces:
DisplayList
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractLayer, BrowserLayer, DefaultDisplayListImpl, DomTextLayer, FlashLayer
public interface Layer

Layer is a core Chronoscope drawing abstraction

It is the key immediate-mode render API used for drawing shapes, corresponding very close to the Safari/WHATWG Javascript CANVAS.

Author:
Ray Cromwell <ray@timepedia.org>

createDisplayList

DisplayList createDisplayList(java.lang.String id)
Create a DisplayList tied to this layer with the given unique identifier. DisplayLists can not be shared across Canvas or Layer instances.

Parameters:
id - a unique identifier

getLayerOrder

int getLayerOrder()
Return the Z order of this layer

getScrollLeft

int getScrollLeft()
a layer may be created bigger than its actual bounds, in which case there are hidden areas which are clipped. This returns the x coordinate of the upper left of the drawing surface relative to the visible bounds.
